Topic.Title: I know a few are indifferent to the Olympics because they see it as a big feel good lib festival.

Message.Msg: I've been really busy so I really haven't been payingattention. I did hear one or two radio talk show hosts complaining that the Olympic Games are a lib thing: track & field for diversity and world peace. That sort of thing. One commentator complained that the games have often or not have intensified hostilites and maybe lead to war. 1936 Berlin Olympics for example. I heard complaints about some of the countries included in the games including: Puerto Rico (as its own country) and the (so called) Palestinian territories. I heard complaints that the Olympic organizers declined to have a moment of silence for the Is real ie team that was murdered by terrorists years ago. (On the anniversary of the event.) I haven't heard anybody contend that it was Obama's Team and they wanted his team to lose. Nor have I heard anyone claim they wanted black Americans to do poorly during the games. I have heard a number of complaints about free condums. Both "official" free condums and "unofficial" free condums. And about the supposed orgy of sex going on after the athlete's personal events are over. There is a certain amount of rivalry between America & China. Last I heard, USA had more oeverall medals. But China may have had a few more gold medals. Don't know if that held up to the end. America was doing well in some of the later events. I was staying over at a customers house and got to watch some of the events. The gymnast Gabby Douglas was pretty cool. At another customers house I got to watch some of the running and the beach volley ball. I also got to see the Canadians doing synchronized swimming. How boring is that? But I think your claim that Conservatives (or Republicans) are cheering for Obama's Team to lose is just plain all wet. Among other things, these athleates have been traing for years before Obama became president. And they represent America, not Obama. We all like to see America doing well.

Message.Title: gop healthcare mandate
Message.Msg: the gop house budget has a mandate: “If you’re an individual who’s not covered by Medicare, you’re eligible for a tax credit up to $2,300 to purchase insurance. If you don’t purchase insurance, you get nothing. So, in practice, there’s a $2,300 penalty for not purchasing insurance. In essence, you’re giving the government $2,300, and you only get it back if you buy health-care insurance. It’s slightly more roundabout than an individual mandate, but it’s the same idea.” Klein
